Review_body: Love a movie that was clearly made by someone who grew up in the 80s and loves slasher classics. Blumhouse watered it down for rating but its a fun thrill with some good laughs!

The protagonist dies in some interesting ways. At one point she gets pulled over by a cop. She tells him she takes drugs saying, "I do all that!" hoping that once she is in jail she will be safe from her murderer. That didn't work for her (or the cop). As the movie progresses all these deaths start to take a toll on her body. She needs to find her killer before she dies for good. Nice twist at the end.

This was quite entertaining. Tree gets murdered on her birthday and relives the same day over and over again like she's in a time loop. She spends each day trying to find out who the masked killer is. A Ground Hog Day meets Scream. A slasher movie with suspense, horror and comedy. It has jumpy moments like Friday the 13th. Brilliant how Universal Pictures starts off by repeating the same bit of music a few times. There is some tongue in cheek moments like the poster on the wall in the film that reads "Today is the first day of the rest of your life".

Review title: A funny idea, and a funny horror
Review_body: I found this movie to be very light and funny. I almost wouldn't classify it as a horror. However, it wasn't too surprising. I guessed the killer nearly immediately yet the movie played on an on seemly trying to throw me off. I even almost thought I had it wrong once with a "no way, really?" moment. I was full the classic moments where one is going "why?" or "don't go there!" of a slasher movie which keeps it interesting. The main character is I suppose meant to be full of various selfish behaviors, but I almost liked the "change my life" version worse. One glaring flaw is that she never seems to guess the sex of her attacker despite repeated deaths. Don't expect to much depth from any of the characters, but hey it is a slasher and that is expected.While it was a pleasant slasher, I found no reason I would actually want to hang with the prime character, the sorority girl. Sorry, Jessica Rothe you simply wouldn't be my first choice of friend or date which perhaps is Scott Lobdell's fault. Even when she chooses to "turn her life around", I was still left thinking I wouldn't much care to hang with her. The only reason I am saying this is because despite the funny antics and the fun figure it out "who dun it" puzzle, Jessica (a.k.a. Tree) cause me not to care near as much about the overall plot. I would actually have found the movie even more entertaining if she failed and was finally killed off if it weren't for the fact that her killer seemed even less appealing.I would recommend watching this movie despite it's drawbacks, it is still quite hilarious. The end was a little disappointing and it almost seems like it is intended for a younger audience yet doesn't quite qualify.

I fully expected this to be a typical, snarky, teen-age jump-scare movie, but I went anyway. I was very happily surprised at how good it is. The main character actually develops so you are invested in her. It wasn't as predictable as most movies are - especially teen-age "horror" flicks. I have recommended this movie highly - for the genre. It's a much better movie than I thought it would be, and I hope that there are more like this released. It isn't what I would call a horror film, but it was great to see more plot than usual and not buckets and buckets of fake blood spurting everywhere.
I love a good thriller. This is by far the best horror twist to Groundhog's Day. It's funny, thrilling and entertaining.

7/10 simply because it is hilarious asf.Went on Netflix to watch a  scary movie and chose this one. Not a masterpiece, but I was pleasantly surprised. The movie is funny and entertaining. I laughed throughout the whole thing. It is obvious that this was their goal and that they didn't attempt to make an actual horror film.
Can definitely recommend if you're in the mood for a "horror" movie that's not too serious.

Review title: Very Fun, especially watching with friends
Review_body: This movie isn't art, I start by saying this because that's the first thing you should know. However if you go into a movie called "Happy Death Day" expecting art then i cant help you. Overall the movie is so much damn fun. While yes i can understand why some folks would call it horrible, because it essentially is, its still fun. The writing isn't anything to write home about but even a lot of the bad cringe lines are funny, and its so much fun watching it with your friends. Watch it for yourself, it certainly is a movie I'd watch again. Just good overall fun.

Review title: One of the worst movies I've ever seen
Review_body: This is not an intellectual movie, it's very repetitive and the genres of this movie is not correct at all. It's more of an comedy mixed with romance and some mildly jump-scares. Not a movie suited for me personally at all, although some of my emotional friends did enjoy it. I don't know how this got all the hype it got because it is not worth watching, I wanted to leave the cinema after the third rollback.

Don't watch it if you are in for a gory slasher, but if you like a bit of suspense with (teenage) humor, you're in the right place. Watched this movie with a smile on my face, but I was still interested int he mysterious side of the movie.

I can't believe I waited so long to watch this movie. The script, the acting, and the plot had me on the edge of my seat. I expected some typical and stupid overdone slasher flick but instead this movie delivered an excellent performance and honest character development. Being a fan of Groundhog Day I knew what route the movie would take but adding in the 'who-done-it' slasher aspect made for a little twist. I was not disappointed and for anybody thinking of overlooking it should definitely give it a chance.

Review_body: OK, first of all let me tell you this. I have never written a movie review before nor have I wanted to but for 'Happy death day' I had to make an exception. From opening sequence to the end credits, this film was incredibly bad. After seeing it, I wanted a refund and questioned whether I should ever watch a movie again. I am a regular movie goer and so can appreciate just how terrible this really is. There was not one single redemable quality the movie showed me why some people choose to end their own lives. From the cringey awful casting and dialogue, to the tired and predictable ending, this is hands down the worst thing I've seen since concentration camps. Please please do not spend actual money to see this abomination. I must go now and ponder suicidal thoughts.

Review title: If you don't know what you're in the mood for, watch this.
Review_body: This movie has it all: suspense, intrigue, then amusing, sorority girls, silliness, and even 16 candles-ish romance. Very light but super watchable. In a good way I did not recognize the actors so it made it more of a light watch.

Review title: There is a good movie named Blade Runner 2049, watch it instead.
Review_body: So, where to we start. This movie at first instance looks innovating and fresh, but the more forward it goes, the more bored you becomes. The plot looks kind of innovative, a groundhog day meets horror, but the groundhog day premise with different genre is done better with Edge of tomorrow. The comedy in this film is equally awful, and the scares aren't scary enough. It's like someone saw the cabin in the woods and made his own fan fiction with a more serious tone. The characters are blank and offers nothing new. Some of them are there for comic relief but they fail too. The only good thing about this movie is that its pacing is somewhat good, not too slow, not too fast, and also that the premise is not half bad. But in the fall, you should better watch blade runner 2049 or Jackie Chan's The foreigner. These two films deserve more attention than this piece of crap. Not like I am forcing you, but just giving an opinion.

Review title: It was a good popcorn movie. Except it wasn't.
Review_body:
I taught it was a horror comedy first, so I sat down in front of the TV without any serious expectations. Honestly I enjoyed watching the movie a little and I laughed some times. 
But after watching it I came here and I saw the genre: Horror, Mystery, Thriller. Seriously? The gerne is a mislead. It was a pathetic horror movie or a lame yet one-time watchable horror comedy, you can pick one. Some says here in the review section like "expect the unexpected" or "Smart movie with depth" et cetera, that's why I watched this movie. 
I have a good sense to tell who's the murderer, but smart movies can mislead me some times. It' s not a smart horror, I could smell the killer from miles away from the very beggining and I was begging all along "please be wrong, please be wrong", but I wasn't. I thaught we live in a century when directors and screenwriters already know how to mislead the audience. I am disappointed.My "favorite" scene was when the killer explained why he/ she wanted to kill the poor girl. The explanation was so LAME that I wanted to die instead of her. They ruined pretty much everything in this movie. I hated almost every character in the movie and I wanted them all to die.But again, I thaught it was a horror comedy, so the movie got a 5 star from me, because I didn't fall asleep watching this, I laughed several times and I saw way worse horrors than this.

Review title: Good story idea, blended with a classic slasher.
Review_body:
I was very excited to see this movie, the idea of the story line really appealed to me, although the idea is similar I wish everyone would stop likening to groundhog day. 
This movie contains everything you'd want and expect from a classic slasher style, plus some entertaining bits with a splash of romance (to some extent). I do feel as if this plot could be better projected in a more 'serious' horror story however, it did work well in this context to. Rothe played the role brilliantly to top it off, I really enjoyed her character and several others. I would recommend this as a watch, just don't expect too much! 7.

Review title: A college student must relive the day of her murder over and over again, in a loop that will end only when she discovers her killer's identity.
Review_body: Happy Death Day Review By Jordan WhittenPlot: A college student must relive the day of her murder over and over again, in a loop that will end only when she discovers her killer's identity.Although the concept and idea was a copy of Groundhog day, it turned out to be a thrilling, mysterious and intense film with loads of drama and action. However, does that make it a good movie? I guess we'll find out more in this review of Happy Death Day.The first thing I will say about this movie is that it is more funnier than scary. So if you're not a big fan of scary horror movies, there is literally nothing to be afraid of. You only encounter really 1 jump scare which is debatably scary, whether you are faint-hearted/timid person you would we quite frightened. The movie Happy Death Day featured the main character Tree Gelbman (Jessica Rothe) and secondary main characters: Carter Davis (Israel Broussard), Lori Spengler (Ruby Modine), and Gregory Butler (Charles Aitken). Without a doubt the acting was great. Few errors were spotted throughout the whole motion picture. So no complaints there.Other than that, the film felt like it was dragging on forever and it was never going to end. Considering it kept showing the same scenes over and over again which gradually got boring. Just when you think Tree might live to the next day, she doesn't, and that could really get you on your nerves and it frustrated me at one point in the movie. However, at the end of the movie when Tree finally discovered who her murderer is, I felt so relieved. After all the build up it all turned out to be quite useful in the end. It made the audience feel ecstatic. The film really keeps you guessing who the murderer is, I think it is an excellent movie in the mystery genre. I urged to discover who the killer was, I think it was it was killing me more than it was killing tree.In conclusion, I personally think the movie is good, not great or amazing but just plain good. There were a couple faults I found in the movie, but there was also some really good things that happened in the film. It also shares some life lessons which is kinda neat. If you are going to see this motion picture, do not expect it to be a full on horror movie that will keep you on your feet. Although it does seem that away in the trailer, it's actually a really fun movie with Jessica Rothe saying a few funny jokes here and there. Happy Death Day is nothing that I expected it to be and I like that, hopefully you do too.Personal Rating: 6.4/10 Is it worth watching: YES

Review title: While flawed, a great film with a surprising ending
Review_body: I noticed a few of the reviews on here were posted without those users having actually watched the film.I was lucky enough to go to a preview of the film, and was not disappointed. Starting off pretty slow with unlikeable characters, the film picked up in the best way possible. Throws a few curve balls at you which is always fun. Acting was great across the board - lead did really well in her role. While not the scariest movie, it's definitely entertaining and will keep your adrenaline running.

Starts off great introducing the story and then BANG a killer comes along and starts the story. The amount of humour was perfect and this movie contained heaps of jump scares. Also the ways she planned to find her killer were good. Another great bit was all the tense moments in this movie that made you want to watch. The acting was so good from all the actors. And the twists at the end made it even better. My new horror favorite will be getting the mask for Halloween. I LOVED THIS MOVIE Aged 12

Went to movie theater with low expectations, but this movie surprised me! I would not classify this movie as Horror/Mystery/Thriller, but as a Comedy with horror elements - it was funny, i liked all characters and plot twists. I would definitely recommend watching it – film was executed very well and kept me entertained the whole time!
Jessica Rothe is one of the worst actresses i've ever seen in a movie. The movie itself is bad written and very silly.

Such a fun movie! More than just a slasher movie, it mixes horror, comedy, romance and sci-fi. It's a great surprise and an excellent revival for slaher movies. Jessica Rothe fits perfectly in the character of Tree. She shines on screen. Congratulations to Blumhouse, delivering another great film.

Happy Death Day, being of quite low budget, was the first movie I saw alone with my friends. It was really funny and had a mix of comedy, drama, and horror. The first death scene was the scariest and all the jump scares were expected but at the same time unexpected. It is a very thought out movie and cliché at times although the reveal of the killer is just mind blowing and twisted. There is not a minute in the movie where you don't rethink the killer is someone else.Jessica Rothe plays the character of Tree very well and you see her character change personality throughout the film. The idea of taking a baby face (the mask for the killer) creates a suspenseful and creepy atmosphere.I think there should be a sequel to this movie as it would make a killer story line and tie in very well with this one. Great movie and would definitely see it again.

Review title: I don't usually like horror but...
Review_body: Every moment of this is fun as heck. Even though I figured out who the murderer was pretty early on, I was totally intrigued by all the little mysteries. And rather than get more boring with each repetition, the movie actually gets funnier and weirder the longer it goes on. The writers really thought through the logic of the premise and made it like a game or puzzle with - so important - a ticking clock. All the performances are so funny and feel at least a little like real college students. If you're looking for thrills that won't fudge you up, definitely give it a go. I loved it!!!

This is an overrated "Ground Hog Day"... Minus the humor, acting, or plot. The nasty sorority girl will change to your BFF after self introspection of being murdered 16 times... This after school special was only missing rainbows and pink ponies. 8 out of 10 on the SJW score. Men are effeminate (the hunk is secretly gay). Global Warming, campus rape (your average male doesnt care its happening in his dorm), are all told from the one sided bigoted liberal point of view...The end has a nice twist and FINALLY a "bit" of humor... Thus the 3 out of 10. Good horror movie for school girls
